nodes.description: Oklahoma City启动十周年纪念仪式，包括9:02 CDT开始的168秒沉默
nodes.support_text: the ceremony will begin right about the top of the hour... 9:02 a.m. local time... 168 seconds of silence

nodes.description: 家属在教堂举行仪式后前往纪念广场，为168个受害者座椅放置鲜花和纪念品
nodes.support_text: families' names will be read, and then the families who have gathered will get up from the church, walk across the street and go to the chair

nodes.description: 儿童幸存者宣读纪念使命声明，声明强调铭记受害者、幸存者和受影响者
nodes.support_text: children who survived the daycare center bombing... will read a mission statement during the service

nodes.description: 前州长Frank Keating回顾救援工作，宣读受害者名单并提及9/11纽约消防员牺牲
nodes.support_text: the former governor, too, Frank Keating, will all make special speeches during this ceremony

nodes.description: 副总统Dick Cheney演讲，回顾事件影响并强调美国团结与正义
nodes.support_text: the vice president, Dick Cheney; the former president, Bill Clinton; the former governor, too, Frank Keating, will all make special speeches during this ceremony

nodes.description: 现任州长Brad Henry演讲，强调Oklahoma City复苏与纪念意义
nodes.support_text: the former president, Bill Clinton; the former governor, too, Frank Keating, will all make special speeches during this ceremony

nodes.description: 前总统Bill Clinton演讲，以树木象征重生并呼吁铭记历史
nodes.support_text: the vice president, Dick Cheney; the former president, Bill Clinton; the former governor, too, Frank Keating, will all make special speeches during this ceremony

nodes.description: 幸存者Ernestine Clark分享十年友谊与互助，提及跨地区纪念活动
nodes.support_text: we were talking with a gentleman who lost his daughter... after the interview, he got up and he said

nodes.description: 博物馆开放受害者照片展览，强调纪念的持续与社区责任
nodes.support_text: a new exhibit that opened up just this week and it's titled 'Forever Changed and Changing Forever'

nodes.description: 切换至Bill Hemmer的专题报道
Bill Hemmer展示民众情绪照片
Bill Hemmer引导仪式流程讲解
